characters: THE SHERIFF'S BOAT AND HANK'S BOAT
A FENCE LACED WITH CONCERTINA WIRE
THE SHERIFF, WAYNE, PHIL AND HANK
TWO KEYS ON A KEY RING
WITH THE SHERIFF AND HIS MEN
TOM SITS UP, SWINGING HIS LEGS OVER THE SIDE OF THE COT.
THE HEADLIGHTS OF A GMC SUBURBAN

dialogues.speaker: RAIN
dialogues.text: Falls from low grey clouds. Down below we see...

dialogues.speaker: THE RIVER
dialogues.text: Muddy, slow and powerful, overflowing its banks. In the n distance is...

dialogues.speaker: THE RESERVOIR
dialogues.text: Filled to the maximum, water thundering out of two open g We close in on...

dialogues.speaker: THE DAM
dialogues.text: There's a Dam Control Office in the middle of the dam. We MOVE OFF the reservoir and head out over...

dialogues.speaker: THE TOWN OF HUNTINGBURG
dialogues.text: We see "NO FEAR" spelled out in stones on one man's roof. go down and into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Storefronts are sandbagged and closed. A sign on one stor reads: GONE FISHING. A sign on another: HEY LOOTER. NOTHI OF VALUE HERE. TRY NEXT DOOR. And on the next store: HE'S LYING.

dialogues.speaker: A CHURCH
dialogues.text: Beautiful, old, ringed with a five-foot-high wall of sand The floodwater is up to the first level of sandbags.

dialogues.speaker: CARS AND PICKUP TRUCKS
dialogues.text: Loaded down, are heading out of town on streets covered i the first water of the flood.

dialogues.speaker: A STATUE
dialogues.text: On an island in the middle of the street. It's Civil War- era, of a general on a horse, sword held high. The floodw is over the curb, lapping at the base of statue's pedesta Near the statue stands...

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF
dialogues.text: 50s, with soft edges and friendly eyes. He's talking into his radio mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, are we all going to die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANK, the dam control officer, is on the radio with the  Sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not right now. But I'm gonna have to  let out a little more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAYNE and PHIL, two deputies, 30s, are near the Sheriff,  shoring up a sandbag wall that has partially collapsed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think my best was when I turned  twelve. My Dad set up a treasure  hunt. It was really cool. (off Wayne's disdainful  look) Well, it was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne shrugs a "whatever" and pulls a sandbag up out of t water. There's unpleasant-looking muck all over his arms. drops the sandbag back into the water and shakes off the  crud with disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This blows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My most awful birthday was sweet  sixteen. I had mono. How about you?  What was your worst?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kidding? You think I could've  possibly had a birthday worse than  this? What kind of loser do you think  I am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't answer that, Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff walks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hank says he's gonna open another  gate. We're gonna get another rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn at the sound of honking. The MAYOR drives up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen. Hey -- happy birthday,  Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne nods. Phil stiffens. They do not like this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Sheriff) Mike, I gotta say, what you're  doing... I don't know if I'd be here,  considering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (good-natured) Well, you would be if you wanted to  get the last couple of paychecks  some bastard owed you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins, then:) I just want you to know I think the  people 'round here made a big mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil grumbles to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The people"? You're the one who  screwed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Phil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blushes) I, uh --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mayor, saving  Phil) You know, Bob, as much as I'd love  to stand here all day talking about  how great I am, if you don't get  moving I'm gonna have to haul your  sorry ass off to jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Okay, okay, I'm going. Keep up the  good work, boys. It's appreciated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor rolls up his window and heads off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whaddya say we go torch the fucker's  house and blame it on looters. Or  how about we put a dead cow in his  living room. He comes back after  it's been in the water a couple of  days. Hello!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes head) You wanna know how to get the best  revenge on the Mayor and his boys?  You do exactly what we're doing. You  protect the town. You protect it  better than they would. Better than  they ever could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks, shrugs) I think the dead cow's better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignores Wayne) Any looter that comes in here is in  for a big surprise, cause as long as  I'm still wearing this pointy thing... (indicates badge) ...nobody's taking anything from  this town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nervous assistant bank manager WELLMAN is hurriedly tossi stacks of money into two canvas bags.

dialogues.speaker: A MAN'S SHADOW
dialogues.text: Washes up on Wellman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think you could go a little  faster, pal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I -- I'm going as fast as I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's not fast enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wellman is about to speak, then sees something, gulps.

dialogues.speaker: A SHOTGUN
dialogues.text: Is held by one of the men, pointed at the floor.

dialogues.speaker: WELLMAN
dialogues.text: Sweeps the money off the shelves and into the bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. We don't keep any of our --

dialogues.speaker: THE TWO MEN
dialogues.text: Ignore Wellman, grab the canvas bags and stride off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON the lower half of the front doors as they fly op Out come TWO MEN in long dark raincoats.

dialogues.speaker: WELLMAN
dialogues.text: Runs up, stopping in the open door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, wait!

dialogues.speaker: THE TWO MEN
dialogues.text: As they slowly turn to face Wellman. We just see their fa shielded from the rain by hat brims. Meet...

dialogues.speaker: TOM AND CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Tom, 30, handsome, with an easy smile. Charlie, 50, with tough, red face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: WELLMAN
dialogues.text: Looks nervous for a second, then holds up a clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forgot to sign.

dialogues.speaker: TOM AND CHARLIE
dialogues.text: We see, for the first time, by their hats and uniforms, t they are armored car drivers. There's an armored car park at the curb, on the other side of a low wall of sandbags. Charlie sighs, goes back to Wellman and perfunctorily sig the form. Then he and Tom go to the sandbag wall. Tom hol both bags in one hand and the shotgun in the other. Charl doesn't want to get wet. He steps from the sandbag wall onto the rear bumper of th truck, then keys open the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie reaches out for the money bags. Tom jumps off the sandbag wall and lands in the water, splashing Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Christsakes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a flood, Charlie. You're gonna  get wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie takes the bags, tosses them in then shuts the bac He moves toward the front, still trying to keep out of th water. Tom splashes him some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Do you know what kind of crap  is in that water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (of course he knows) Well, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom kicks some more water at Charlie. Charlie gives Tom a withering look and climbs in the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie gets into the driver's seat; Tom climbs into the  shotgun seat. They shut and bolt the doors. Charlie gets the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dispatch, this is 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're leaving Huntingburg. We'll be  back in an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten-four. Get out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gone. Over and out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie hangs up the radio. He starts writing on a clipbo Silence for a few moments, and then Charlie notices Tom  staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about my ear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a major hair growth going  on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious. You're gonna need  somebody to go in there with a weed  whacker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie grabs a donut bag off the seat and tosses it to T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're offering me one of your donuts?  I don't know what to say. I'm getting  all misty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it'll shut your mouth you can  have the whole bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie starts the truck. Tom thinks about it, then tosse the bag back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. I start eating donuts and I'll  never get out of this truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgusted) I love how you think you're better  than this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get me wrong, Charlie. There's  a lot to like about this job -- and  I don't just mean the dashing  polyester ensemble and the solid  three-figure income.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) You ungrateful shit! I don't believe  you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Charlie, relax! I was kidding!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't wanna do this? Fine. Go  back to selling hot construction  machinery. That's a helluva career.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It had better hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie slams the clipboard down on the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think this is a joke? This is  funny? Jesus Christ! You know how  lucky you are you could get in here?  Thirty years old and all the crap  you pulled and you never got caught?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) That wasn't luck, old man. That was  skill. I was good at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, it takes a lot of skill to  fence bulldozers. That's goddamn  genius time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About as much skill as it takes to  sit in a truck and get fat eating  donuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, so that's all I've been doing,  huh? Just wasting my life away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, building a home, raising a  family -- that's just stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what, Tom? I really don't  give a shit what you said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom doesn't reply. Charlie puts the truck in gear; starts off. Tom looks at Charlie, shakes his head -- what was th about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Writing letters in a crossword puzzle. Holding the pen is

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Late 50s, with a creased face and piercing eyes. He's sit at the bar, drinking coffee. Rain sheets down outside. Th BARTENDER watches TV, sound off. Next to Jim at the bar a

dialogues.speaker: RAY, KENNY AND MR. MEHLOR
dialogues.text: Ray, 40s, has lank hair, rheumy eyes and a glass of Irish whisky in front of him. Kenny, 20s, long hair, has the en of a puppy -- unfortunately he has about as much smarts a puppy. Mr. Mehlor. 40s, looks like -- and was -- a high s teacher.

dialogues.speaker: ON TV
dialogues.text: Sound off, a MAN is crying about what he has lost in the  flood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Thus saith the Lord; Behold, waters  shall rise up out of the north and  be an overflowing flood and all the  inhabitants of the land shall howl."  Jeremiah 47:2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray takes a drink. Kenny leans over to Ray, sotto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna be able to buy a helluva  lot of bibles, huh, Ray? Me? First  thing I'm gonna do is get my brother  a lawyer. Best that money can buy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thought comes to Jim -- an answer to a clue in the cros and he starts filling in words as Ray and Kenny talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he facing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cap a cop or something...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security guard. "In the commission..."  All he's got is a piece of shit P.D.  Now I'm gonna be able to afford him  a good lawyer -- a guy with a haircut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim leans over to Kenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Scuse me a second. Take a look at  thirty-one across.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim slides the newspaper in front of Kenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, Jim. I don't do crossword  puzzles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take a look, Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny can read. (to Kenny) Just look at it. You know when you  write down a word and suddenly it  looks all wrong? Maybe it's right,  but it doesn't look right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim points at the newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-one across.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny shrugs and looks down at the newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mumbles as he reads) Mention money again and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: ECU CROSSWORD PUZZLE
dialogues.text: In an uncompleted part of the puzzle, Jim has written a  message in the boxes. It reads: MENTION MONEY AND I'LL KI YOU.

dialogues.speaker: JIM AND KENNY
dialogues.text: Kenny looks up at Jim. Jim glances over at the bartender  then back at Kenny. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I get it right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Jim. You got it right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie and Tom continue to drive in silence. They both s looks at each other. Their eyes meet for a second, then t look away. A moment's pause then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack-ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hint of a smile on both of them. Tom reaches for Charli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give us a kiss. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie goes red in the face, pushes Tom away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs, beat) You really are a cranky old fart,  you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that about? I mean, I'm  just sitting here and all of a sudden  you go postal on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I... It's just this  weather. I... I want to get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I really do appreciate  what you've done for me. This is a  good job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's not. It stinks. It's putting  your life on the line for someone  else's money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking away from town, the HIGH SCHOOL is on the left. O the right is the CEMETERY. Farther on, on the left, is a AND BOAT DEALERSHIP. The road is covered in water.

dialogues.speaker: THE ARMORED TRUCK
dialogues.text: Goes by the entrance to the high school, water shooting u from the wheels, pushing out in a wide wake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom glances ahead and sees that the road is covered in wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. Where's the road?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stretching out ahead of them are reflector bars on the  telephone poles, a few feet above the rippling surface of the floodwater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's there. (beat) Somewhere. I hope. (beat) Look, Tom, I don't care what it is  you end up doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, here we go again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the last time, I swear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom sees something ahead. He doesn't understand at first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reflector bar on the pole two poles ahead is lower th the others. No reflector bars for a hundred yards, then t resume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at Tom) I just think, whatever it is you do,  it's time you did some heavy lifting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom figures out what's going on with the reflector bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you gotta hear this. You're better  than --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop the truck! We're going down!

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE TRUCK
dialogues.text: The water rises fast up the grille as the truck angles do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie stands on the brakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wave of water rushes forward from the truck, then comes back and washes over the hood, splashing up on the windsh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie throws the truck into reverse but gives it too mu power. They hear the rear wheels spinning underwater. Cha eases off, the tires start to catch, they start moving  backwards. Charlie and Tom exchange a quick look of relief... and th the engine dies. Charlie tries to restart it, but there's nothing.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE TRUCK
dialogues.text: It's stopped on a downgrade -- it's a dip in the road. The water is up to the top of the front tires: up to the  hubcaps on the rear wheels. The headlights are underwater spots of yellow glowing. They've stopped next to a lighte sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOME OF THE 1987 STATE CHAMPION WARRIORS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a little dip in the road or  something. You can see the reflectors  come up the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (curses to himself) I knew this would happen. (grabs radio mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see if there's anyone coming.  Maybe we can get pulled out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom opens the door. Charlie adjusts the radio frequency  selection button; clicks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dispatch, this is 31. 31 calling  dispatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio) 31, this is dispatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Dispatch, we're stuck outside of  Huntingburg. Truck's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on 231, headed for the  Interstate. Right by a sign saying  "Welcome to Huntingburg."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom climbs out and up on top of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE TRUCK
dialogues.text: Tom stands on top of the truck. In one direction, nothing but blackness. The other way he can see the lights of the town. But there are no cars coming.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TRUCK
dialogues.text: Charlie looks over as Tom appears, upside-down, in the  doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The town's been evacuated. We won't  get any help from there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dispatch can't get anyone out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are aware we're carrying a  shitload of money...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They called the National Guard.  They're gonna be here in about ninety  minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ninety minutes? Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods; into radio) Dispatch, we're gonna need help a  little sooner than --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a sudden sparking sound and the radio cuts out an interior lights and the headlights go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking out as the Sheriff's car rolls past on the water- covered street. A HAND lets go of a curtain and it swings across the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff motions Wayne to stop the car, then he grabs radio mike and clicks it on as a megaphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Henry, I saw you. Come on out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one comes out of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry, I'm not leaving until you  come out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few moments pass and then...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY AND DOREEN SWERZKY
dialogues.text: Late 70s, step out onto their porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus H. Christ, Henry, I told you  to stay away from the damn window.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you still doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're setting traps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's illegal, Doreen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna arrest us, Sheriff? Hell,  are you even sheriff anymore, Sheriff?  Didn't you lose an election? I sure  as hell know I didn't vote for you,  and neither did Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doreen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need to set traps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what they said in '73. When  we got back, anything the bastards  didn't steal they broke, just for  the hell of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not happening this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn right it's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't stay, you know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to my sister's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon as we finish setting the traps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff wants to say something more, but he's not abo to argue with Doreen. He just nods and gets back into the car.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CAR
dialogues.text: The Sheriff climbs back in. He and Wayne watch Henry and  Doreen go back into the house, Doreen still nagging at He

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God'll understand if you have to  drown her in the basement, Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff sighs, nods to Wayne. Wayne puts the car in g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water is creeping up the sloping hood of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The money's safe; we're not. Water  rose about a foot in the last twenty  minutes. The National Guard isn't  going to be here for another hour.  You do the math.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom shrugs -- Charlie's right. They're about to get out w light washes up on them. They look out to see...

dialogues.speaker: THE HEADLIGHTS OF A GMC SUBURBAN
dialogues.text: Approaching on the other side of the dip, a quarter-mile  away.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE AND TOM
dialogues.text: Look at each other then get out of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: THE SUBURBAN
dialogues.text: Stops on the far side of the dip -- a hundred yards away. The headlights shine across the water. Doors open and MEN get out.

dialogues.speaker: TOM AND CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Come around the front of the truck. They can't see throug the glare of the Suburban's bright headlights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? You stuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see if we can get you out!  We'll be right over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie looks at Tom, relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like we might just --

dialogues.speaker: THE SUBURBAN
dialogues.text: Headlights go on high beam.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE AND TOM
dialogues.text: Squint, blinded by the high beams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd they do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably so they can see better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or so we can't see at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie looks at him -- what does he mean? Tom puts his h on his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WATER
dialogues.text: Assembled by the Suburban are...

dialogues.speaker: JIM AND HIS MEN
dialogues.text: All holding guns. He speaks to them quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my retirement fund, boys,  and if any one of you screws up, I  swear to God I'll kill you. Let's  go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start wading down into the dip in the road. Kenny ca a rifle.

dialogues.speaker: TOM AND CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Tom squints through the bright light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Company dispatch and the National  Guard are the only ones who know  we're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone with a scanner from Radio  Shack could've intercepted your call,  Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizes) Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jim and men) Could you turn down your lights?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're bringing a rope!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn down your lights!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be right there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom starts to pull his gun.

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: is fired up on adrenalin. He has his rifle up and is aimi it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom with his hand on his pistol, starting to pull it out.

dialogues.speaker: TOM AND CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Charlie sees Tom going for his gun. He moves close to Tom half in front of him, putting his hand on Tom's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy, Tom.

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Stiffens.

dialogues.speaker: KENNY'S FINGER
dialogues.text: Squeezes the trigger of his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Jumps at the sound of the rifle crack.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Is knocked back.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Yanks out his gun and starts shooting back.

dialogues.speaker: JIM AND HIS MEN
dialogues.text: Duck down in the water.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Shooting blindly, looks over and sees...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: A horrible look on his face, blood coming out of his neck He sinks into the water.

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Shoots off another few quick rounds.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Drops into the water, bullets plugging in around him. Jus his hand and pistol are visible, shooting blindly back to Jim and his men. THE SUBURBAN Is hit by Tom's fire.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Runs out of bullets. A beat later we see Charlie start mo through the water -- Tom is pulling him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STOP SHOOTING!

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Doesn't hear Jim and keeps firing.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Aims his pistol at Kenny's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny stops.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THE ARMORED TRUCK
dialogues.text: Tom comes up in the water behind the truck, gasping, hold Charlie. Tom rests his gun on the truck bumper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie's gone.

dialogues.speaker: JIM AND HIS MEN
dialogues.text: Jim glares at Kenny, his eyes on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was going for his gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wasn't gonna shoot, Kenny.  Goddamnit! (shakes head, calls  to Tom) We just want the money! Get away and  we won't have to kill you!

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Shuts his eyes, thinking, scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom opens his eyes. He looks down at...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Floating in the water.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: What the hell is he going to do?

dialogues.speaker: JIM AND HIS MEN
dialogues.text: Jim's men look at him. Jim motions them to wait some more

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got thirty seconds to get the  hell away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and the others wait, but there's no answer from Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock's running! Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still no response from Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All they can see is the front of the truck, in the light the "Welcome" sign. They can't see the back.

dialogues.speaker: JIM AND HIS MEN
dialogues.text: Jim nods to his men. They head for the truck, down into t deeper water at the bottom of the dip in the road. All ha guns up and ready. Jim sends Mr. Mehlor and Ray out to circle around. They a move quietly. The only sound is the rain.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Gets to the truck and moves along its side, Kenny right b him. Jim gets to the back of the truck, nods for Kenny to cover him, then steps out behind the truck, gun up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is gone.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Is floating in the water, eyes of glass.

dialogues.speaker: KENNY, MR. MEHLOR AND RAY
dialogues.text: Step into the circle of light thrown by the "Welcome" sig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes Charlie) Ah, Jesus. (to Kenny) Your dad'd be real proud of you,  Kenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was going for his gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mehlor, I believe we're gonna  need your science project.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mehlor nods and digs into his pack. Ray looks down at Charlie in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I shall bring floodwaters upon the  earth to destroy all that lives under  the heavens and every creature that  has the breath of life in it shall  perish." Genesis 6:17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you a preacher or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray did five years in the hole at  Joliet. The only thing you get to  read in the hole is the Bible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ray) You got religion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mehlor laughs as he pulls something out of his pack.  It's...

dialogues.speaker: SMALL EXPLOSIVE DEVICE
dialogues.text: A half-stick of dynamite with a timer, mounted on a magne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you hit the switch you've got  thirty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You teach your students how to make  things like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mehlor puts the device on the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been to a high school recently,  Ray? My students taught me how to  make things like that. Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's wrong. Jim touches the handle on the door. It moves. Uh-oh. He raises his pistol, grabs the door handle and pulls. The door swings open. We don't need to see wha he sees -- we can tell from the expression on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is running hard through the knee-deep water, pulling string of canvas money bags buckled together. The truck a "Welcome" sign are two hundred yards behind him. Tom hear an angry yell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny is the one yelling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. Everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They quiet. The patter of the rain is too loud -- they ca hear anything. Jim scans the horizon, but sees nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now why'd he have to go and do a  thing like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To stay alive. (off their looks) He thinks we'll kill him -- unless  he knows where the money is and we  don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is another possibility. (off their looks) He's thinking of keeping it for  himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's always that. Either way, we  got ourselves a sharp one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim is looking at something in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty soon the water'll be too deep  for him to run. But for us it'll be  just deep enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unclear) Deep enough for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glass window is smashed and water floods into the boat  showroom. Jim and his men stride in. Kenny ogles a  particularly nice cruiser. Jim stops at a smallish ski-bo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: cruiser) What about this monster?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: ski-boat) This is all we need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, Jim, we're stealing. Can't we  take anything we want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water isn't very deep yet. We  need something with a low draft. Mr.  Mehlor -- find us some gasoline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mehlor heads off.

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Sees something else he likes. We don't see what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jim...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The name WILLIAM PORTMAN is chiseled into a crypt. Tom ap from underwater, gasping for breath. He gets to his feet trudges off through the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom comes out through the gates of the cemetery, splashin through the knee-deep water. He's running when he hears,  from behind him, boat engines firing up. He turns to see.

dialogues.speaker: LIGHTS
dialogues.text: Racing toward him over the water, a hundred and fifty yar back.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Sprints off.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKI-BOAT
dialogues.text: Jim is steering the ski-boat. Mr. Mellor hunkers down bes him. We PULL BACK to see...

dialogues.speaker: TWO JET-SKIS
dialogues.text: Flanking the ski-boat, piloted by Kenny and Ray.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ROAD
dialogues.text: Tom is running as fast as he can. He looks back, sees the ski-boat and jet-skis closing. They'll get him before he  gets to town. He suddenly veers off the road toward...

dialogues.speaker: THE HIGH SCHOOL
dialogues.text: The sign out front reads: GO WARRIORS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom runs around the side of the high school.

dialogues.speaker: JIM AND HIS MEN
dialogues.text: Ride up on the ski-boat and jet-skis and round the corner

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sign of Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut your engines!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The engines are shut down. They all drift. Jim shines a  flashlight over onto...

dialogues.speaker: WINDOWS
dialogues.text: There's a hole in a window large enough to climb through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom wades through the classroom, pushing floating desks a Flashlight beams stab into the room. Tom hurries to the h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim turns to his men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get him out. But for Godsake,  whatever you do... (with a hard look at  Kenny) ...don't kill him. Not until we find  out where he hid that money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom makes his way past banks of lockers, trying to get as far as he can from the probing flashlight beams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny drifts up to the front doors. He pulls on them. Loc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mehlor?

dialogues.speaker: MR. MEHLOR
dialogues.text: Reaches into his pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom tries lockers, looking for a place to hide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny rides his jet-ski fast away from the front doors an the doors explode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom ducks down as...

dialogues.speaker: A FIREBALL
dialogues.text: Shoots over him.

dialogues.speaker: KENNY AND RAY
dialogues.text: Ride the jet-skis into the flooded school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is swimming as hard as he can, out of breath. KENNY A

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Ray goes off down a hall while Kenny idles in the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Surfaces, gasping.

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Hears the gasp, turns, grinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enemy sub off the port bow!

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Gets to his feet runs as fast as he can down the hall. He rounds a corner and keeps going.

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Guns his engine and takes off after Tom.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Runs another thirty feet, then trips on something and goe down.

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Comes around the corner, grinning when he sees...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Halfway down the hall, standing frozen, caught in Kenny's light.

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Guns it, racing forward down the hall toward Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full steam ahead!

dialogues.speaker: THE JET-SKI
dialogues.text: Hits something underwater and stops.

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Keeps going. He flies through the air, slams headfirst in a trophy case and drops into the water.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Stands up -- he was kneeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Low tide, sailor.

dialogues.speaker: A HANDRAIL
dialogues.text: On the wall, angles down into the water. Underwater there are a couple of steps leading up to a change in level in hall -- that's what the jet-ski grounded on.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Ray motors down the hallway toward the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Around the corner comes a jet-ski. Ray assumes it's Kenny

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the jet-ski speeds up and shoots by him. Ray sees it

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Wearing Kenny's hat and jacket.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Gives chase.

dialogues.speaker: SCHOOL HALLWAYS
dialogues.text: Ray races after Tom along the flooded hallways, taking th turns fast. Ray pulls a gun, starts shooting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tearing through the halls, flashlight lighting the way.  Bullets hit the walls, ceiling, water around him.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Comes around a corner, sees the open front doors ahead of him.

dialogues.speaker: JIM AND MR. MEHLOR
dialogues.text: Come into view in the ski-boat, blocking the exit.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Turns hard and speeds down a side hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wall of windows at the end. No way out. Trapped. Then..

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Rises out of the water, blood running down his face, pist up.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Looks back.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Is on his tail.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Makes his choice and guns the jet-ski straight at Kenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yee-hah!

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Fires, misses and is knocked to the side as...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Hunches down on the jet-ski and crashes through the windo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and Mr. Mehlor are moving right outside the windows j as Tom blasts out of the school and races off into the da

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom moves fast over the water. He yanks off his clip-on t

dialogues.speaker: JIM AND THE OTHERS
dialogues.text: Chase Tom's light, behind by fifty yards, heading out int farm fields. They get closer and closer and then watch as

dialogues.speaker: TOM'S JET-SKI
dialogues.text: Runs straight into a tree and explodes.

dialogues.speaker: JIM AND THE OTHERS
dialogues.text: Race up to find the burning, flaming wreckage of the jet- ski. Ray circles on the other jet-ski. Kenny, still bleed from the head, is in the boat with Jim and Mr. Mehlor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Nice driving, buttwipe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you're enjoying this, Kenny,  but if he's dead, how do we find the  money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny reacts -- oh, right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he's still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see what Jim sees.

dialogues.speaker: ECU THROTTLE OF JET-SKI
dialogues.text: Tom used his tie to wrap the throttle open.

dialogues.speaker: HUNDRED YARDS AWAY
dialogues.text: Tom is hiding in the branches of a floating tree, watchin the distant lights of Jim and his men. The current carrie Tom away.

dialogues.speaker: WITH JIM AND HIS MEN
dialogues.text: Jim scans the horizon; sees nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray, I'm in need of a little  inspiration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "With a raging flood he makes an end  of those who oppose him, and pursues  his enemies into darkness." From one  of the more obscure --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to interrupt Bible study and  all, but has no one but me noticed  how completely screwed we are? We  should be back in the motel room,  counting out the money. Instead --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim lashes out with a fist, hard and fast, hitting Kenny the chest, knocking him out of the ski-boat, into the wat Kenny comes up in the thigh-deep water, sputtering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one likes this particular turn of  events, Kenny, but we have a choice --  we can can either deal with it or we  can walk away. There's a lot of money  out there, so I choose to deal with  it. If you want to go, that's fine --  start swimming. You want to stay,  that's fine, too -- just stop your  damn whining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim pushes the throttle forward and the ski-boat takes of leaving Ray on the jet-ski, with Kenny in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's his problem? All the  money in the world ain't worth a  goddamn nickel if you get caught.  It's not like there won't be other  jobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may have more of these in you,  Kenny, but Jim doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray pulls Kenny up onto the jet-ski and takes off after J

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water level is creeping up a five-foot-high wall of  sandbags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking out over the top of the sandbag wall. A tree floa by on the water.

dialogues.speaker: HANDS
dialogues.text: Suddenly appear on the top of the wall and...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Pulls himself into view. He climbs over the wall, exhaust

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THE SANDBAG WALL
dialogues.text: Gasoline-powered pumps are sucking up any rainwater. The  sandbags have kept the floodwater at bay.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: He hurries up the back steps and goes into the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom walks through a small room lined with closed cupboard He goes through a door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom comes out into the altar. He looks around, impressed. It's a beautiful church. Scaffolding goes up one wall -- church is being restored. Tom is startled by a sound from above. He grabs a heavy silver candlestick as a weapon an looks up to see...

dialogues.speaker: BIRDS
dialogues.text: Fluttering up in the rafters.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Takes a breath. Just as he relaxes, he hears a whooshing  sound from behind him and turns to see...

dialogues.speaker: A LARGE CRUCIFIX
dialogues.text: Being swung at his head. Thunk and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom slowly regains consciousness, blinking his eyes. He  hears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the Sheriff isn't asking Tom, he's asking...

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: 30, pretty, even in head-to-toe rain gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was setting up pumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sure as hell don't get what you  see in that church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't expect you to, Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen, did you think the order was  for everyone but you to evacuate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was gonna go as soon as I filled  the pumps, but the next thing I know,  I've got a looter on my hands. Now,  maybe I'm crazy, but I was expecting  a little gratitude?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's great what you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it, Phil. That'll finally get  you into her pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he'd had a gun, Karen? A lot  of these looters carry guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a looter.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Sits up on a cot, behind bars in the holding cell, woozy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and his men are searching the school for the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, it could be anywhere. It might  not even be in the school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain sheets down hard. A lightning flash reveals...

dialogues.speaker: THE STATUE
dialogues.text: The water is up to the horse's knees. The lightning passe and a second later thunder rolls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff, Phil, Wayne and Karen stand outside the cell Tom is inside, on the cot. He touches the cut on his fore

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you doing at the church?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you -- he was looting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just said I'm not a looter! (to Karen) You're the one who nailed me? (Karen nods) You got a better arm than my ex-wife.  What the hell did you hit me with --  a statue? I saw a flash of some guy  coming at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mumbles, embarrassed) It was a crucifix. (to others) It was the only thing there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, great. Now I'm gonna have people  coming from around the world to see  the face of Jesus on my forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, son, what were you doing in  the church?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for a place to hide out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From who -- Swamp Thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bastards who killed my partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That stops the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were driving an armored truck.  The truck got stuck out past the  high school. They must've picked up  our call to dispatch, 'cause they  knew where we were. Charlie and I  were just standing there and all  hell broke loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much money did you have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little over three million.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all exchange a look -- that's a lot of money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bank was afraid of looters. They  had us cleaning out their branches  up and down the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stole three million dollars?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all look at the Sheriff. He looks at Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took the money, didn't you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hid it in the cemetery. Tied it to  a crypt for a guy named Portman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell'd you do that for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like to carry around that  much cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Wayne, use your head. If he  hadn't hidden it, they woulda killed  him, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff looks at Tom -- is that it? Tom nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got any ID?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it was in my jacket and I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Color me surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff thinks for a beat, then tosses some keys to P

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out two rifles and a shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil nods and goes to it. The Sheriff opens a desk drawer pulls out an ankle holster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You believe him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yes, Wayne, I do. And even if  I didn't, I'd say we sure as hell  had an obligation to check it out,  don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff starts strapping on the ankle holster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go with you. I can show you  where --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I think you better stay put. But  that was --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, all we need is an armored car  guy helping us out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff thwacks Wayne in the ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne, what's the worst that's ever  happened to you? When old Mrs. Dugan  went after you with a knife? This  guy just got shot at! (dismisses Wayne; to  Tom) Smart move with the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil comes over with the guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Phil) Wayne and I'll check out the cemetery.  You escort Slugger... (nods at Karen) ...out of town. Get her to some high  ground, then come on back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff jams a small pistol into his ankle holster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to fill the pumps --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling her out) Not any more you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff straightens up, grabs a rifle from Phil and p Karen to the door. Wayne goes to Tom's cell door and pull it shut with a click.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He could still be lying!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff rolls his eyes and gestures for Wayne to come along. He opens the door for Karen, Wayne and Phil to go  through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff -- they killed my partner  without any warning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they're gonna regret that, I  guarantee you. They're gonna regret  coming anywhere near this town  tonight. And out he goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water is halfway up the four-foot high wall of sandbags a the station. There are three outboard motorboats moored t the sandbags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil, take Karen's boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff and Wayne climb toward their boats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do it, Phil. The men of  Huntingburg are counting on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just bite me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne laughs as he and the Sheriff fire up their boat eng

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom hears boat engines start up and move away. He lays ba down on the cot, listening to the rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty. Light comes out from under the door to the bathroo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hank is on the can reading a copy of "American Survivalis magazine. An odd reaction comes over his face. He feels  something weird. He looks down.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FLOOR
dialogues.text: Water is seeping in under the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bathroom door flies open and Hank waddles out, pants  around his feet. He shuffles fast to the control wheels a starts spinning them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two gates open fast, all the way, and water thunders out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hank pulls up his pants as he gets on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff! Sheriff!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff and Wayne are motoring in their boats, zoomin through the trees, engine noise obliterating anything com in over the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the radio) Sheriff, come in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil steers Karen's small boat down Main Street, past the statue. The water is up to the rider's stirrups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleading) Did you see the stained glass windows,  Phil? Did you see what a good job  they did? I can't let anything happen  to the church, not after all I've  put into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen, you know I'd do anything for  you, but the Sheriff told me to get  you out of town. I'm sorry. It's for  your own good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're not going to take me back  to the church, then I'll swim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen moves to get out of the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Hey, hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil lets go of the throttle and stands, moving toward Ka

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen suddenly turns on Phil and pushes him out of the bo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my boat. You swim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen guns the engine and shoots off down a side street.  Phil stands in the waist-deep water and watches her go,  flabbergasted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen comes around a corner and drives her boat up to the church. The water is swirling quietly, still a good three feet below the top of the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on the lighted "Welcome to Huntingburg" sign. There a rushing sound and a two-foot-high wall of water hits th sign. The lights explode in geysers of sparks and the wat rushes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff and Wayne are racing through a grove of half- submerged trees. There's a rushing sound above the sound the engines. WHAM! and they're hit by the wall of water.  Wayne falls out of his boat and is lost in the swirling w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and his men are motoring down an alleyway when...

dialogues.speaker: THE WALL OF WATER
dialogues.text: Rushes down the alley.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: The water hits him hard, knocking him off the jet-ski. He swept away by the water.

dialogues.speaker: A FENCE LACED WITH CONCERTINA WIRE
dialogues.text: The surge water shoots through it. And suddenly there's..

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Slammed up against the fence, pinned to it, water rushing over and around and by him. He yells as the wire cuts int him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen is pouring gasoline into the pumps. She hears the rushing and looks up as the surge hits. Wat shoots over the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom hears the sound and opens his eyes -- what the hell i that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wall of water slams in hard, cascading over the sandb wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's two feet of water in the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The building is like a rock in a stream, with the water  rushing up high against one wall, roiling and swirling ar the sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom looks over, stunned, to see... THE DOOR As a fine stream spits in through the keyhole.

dialogues.speaker: THE WINDOWS
dialogues.text: Are heaving as the water rises up against them.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Gets to his feet, woozy and goes to get out of the cell. remembers -- uh-oh: the cell door is locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim pulls Ray, coughing, choking, bleeding, into the ski- boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water level inside is rising fast. It hits the wall  sockets and there's a spit of sparks, then all the desk l go dark. Light still comes from overhead fluorescent pane Tom sees...

dialogues.speaker: TWO KEYS ON A KEY RING
dialogues.text: Laying on the Sheriff's wooden desk. They're four feet aw too far to reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen suddenly has a horrible thought and stops. She shak it off -- doesn't want to think about it -- and mutters t herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll get him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil is clinging to the statue as the water surges by bel him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne gets back into his boat. The Sheriff realizes somet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne... You locked him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom looks through the cell bars at wooden chairs bobbing the water. The Sheriff's desk lifts up, starts floating. gets an idea. He takes his belt off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A telephone pole is half-submerged, being pulled along fa by the current.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom holds one end of the belt and tosses the rest of it a

dialogues.speaker: THE DESK
dialogues.text: Bobbing in the rising water. He misses the keys.

dialogues.speaker: TOM AND THE DESK
dialogues.text: Tom tries again. The belt lands on the desk top. Tom very gently starts pulling. Too hard; the belt starts slipping off the desk. He gets it just right and the desk starts moving toward Tom. He reaches out with his hand,  stretching.

dialogues.speaker: HIS FINGERS
dialogues.text: Touch the top of the desk, start pulling it toward him, a he just gets a firm grip on the desk when...

dialogues.speaker: THE TELEPHONE POLE
dialogues.text: Smashes into a window, bending in the bars on the window, shattering the glass, letting a torrent of water into the room.

dialogues.speaker: THE DESK
dialogues.text: Is moved by the rush of water, but not before Tom grabs..

dialogues.speaker: THE KEYS
dialogues.text: And grips them tight.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Tries the keys in the lock. They don't fit. He looks at t

dialogues.speaker: CU KEYS
dialogues.text: The tag is emblazoned with the Ford logo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great! I can drive out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom tosses the keys into the water and looks around at...

dialogues.speaker: THE WATER LEVEL
dialogues.text: Rising very fast. A foot in ten seconds.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Climbs up the cell bars, the water rising with him. He's  running out of room between himself and the ceiling. Thre feet. Two feet. He's being pushed up by the water toward.

dialogues.speaker: FLUORESCENT LIGHT FIXTURE
dialogues.text: On the ceiling, caged in a wire cover.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Is terrified, about to die. The water rises up past his f

dialogues.speaker: TOM'S HANDS
dialogues.text: Pull his Maglite flashlight from his belt. He takes off t lens and the battery cap, then shakes the batteries out.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Sticks the flashlight tube up through the wire grate over the light fixture. He blows out the water -- like clearing a snorkel -- then breathes. Reprieve for a few moments and then...

dialogues.speaker: THE WATER
dialogues.text: Reaches the top of the flashlight tube and starts to tric in when...

dialogues.speaker: THE FLUORESCENT LIGHT FIXTURE
dialogues.text: Goes dark. In the darkness, there's the sound of tubes  breaking and metal being wrenched.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Looks up, astonished, to see...

dialogues.speaker: THE FLUORESCENT FIXTURE
dialogues.text: Being lifted up and away from above. Streetlight comes in silhouetting...

dialogues.speaker: A FIGURE
dialogues.text: Standing on the roof. The figure leans down and starts tu at the wire cage over the inside of the fixture. In the l Tom sees that it's...

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: And she's pulling as hard as she can, but the wire cage i budging. She pulls out a Swiss Army knife, unfolds a smal knife and starts taking out the screws holding the cage i place. She gets two screws out.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Pulls on the cage and it swings down. He climbs up it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom surfaces in a hole in the roof. There's a vent duct l on the roof -- Karen must've kicked that over to get to t light fixture. Karen helps Tom up. She sits and he lays d on the roof, catching his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I owed you -- for hitting you and  all. But we're even now, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even. (beat, looks around) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe another levee broke upriver.  They've been --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then...

dialogues.speaker: A PROPANE TANK
dialogues.text: Explodes. The fireball rips across the dark sky, illumina everything, showing...

dialogues.speaker: JIM AND HIS MEN
dialogues.text: Fifty feet away -- Jim, Mr. Mehlor and Ray in the ski-boa and Kenny on the jet-ski -- guns aimed at Tom and Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God.

dialogues.speaker: DARKNESS
dialogues.text: As the lightning passes, and in the darkness, the thunder rolls.

dialogues.speaker: JIM AND HIS MEN
dialogues.text: Switch on their lights and move forward. They pass...

dialogues.speaker: CARS
dialogues.text: Floating down the street with other debris. The cars have been damaged by the flood -- one is missing a door.

dialogues.speaker: JIM AND HIS MEN
dialogues.text: When they get closer to the Sheriff's station, what they or don't see -- makes them stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Karen have disappeared. Karen's boat is still moo to the Sheriff's station roof, empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're in the water! Kenny, cut  your engine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny shuts off the engine of the one remaining jet-ski. shuts down the boat engine. They float in silence, scanni the water with their flashlights. There's no sign of Tom Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom motions Karen to follow him. She's freaked and hesita Tom grabs her hand and pulls her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ski-boat and jet-ski are right above them, flashlight playing over the water.

dialogues.speaker: JIM AND HIS MEN
dialogues.text: Reach the roof of the Sheriff's station. Jim looks around

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny, go that way. We'll go down  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of Kenny and Jim heading off in different directions.

dialogues.speaker: TOM AND KAREN
dialogues.text: Rise into view in a car. They gasp for air and keep low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them where the money is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's about to call out. Tom grabs her hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they know where the money is,  they will kill us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Karen can say anything, a flashlight beam comes  swinging toward them and they have to duck underwater.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Watches as his flashlight beam washes over the car. Nothi there. He guns his engine and heads off down the street.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAR
dialogues.text: Floats off around a corner.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CAR
dialogues.text: Tom and Karen surface, catch their breath. Quiet for a fe moments as they both look around to see that Jim and his are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess just drive around until we  run out of gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pissed) Look, I've spent the last eight months  of my life restoring that church,  and I just left it to come save your  ass, so spare me, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) When we get down here a little further  we'll find a place for you to hide. (off her look) I'm gonna get back to the truck and  wait for the National Guard. (checks watch) They should be there pretty soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen nods. Tom looks at her. She's shivering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm fine. The heater just kicked  in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom looks at her, gives a little grin. Their eyes meet fo second, then they look away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil climbs up onto the roof, exhausted. He sees the hole the roof and goes to look at it. As he's looking down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil turns to see...

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF AND WAYNE
dialogues.text: Coasting up in their boats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Someone got him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Maybe Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen? How could she get him out?  You took her out of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I -- It --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hear it, Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happened real fast, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Karen float down the alley in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever been robbed before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The scariest thing that ever  happened before was Charlie running  out of donuts. (off her look) I've only been doing this for a couple  months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not what she wanted  to hear) Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence for a few moments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you do before this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, uh... I sold construction  machinery. (off her look) I was making good money, it just...  I don't know. It just didn't seem  right for me anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you end up in this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My uncle did me a favor; got me in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice favor. How's he gonna feel after  tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My uncle was Charlie -- my partner  in the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom nods -- so is he.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil climbs into the Sheriff's boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She know karate or something, Phil?  Maybe kung fu? I mean, I can't see  how else she could overpower the  likes of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, both of you. Let's go find  Karen; see if she's got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff fires up his engine and heads off, Wayne  following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen and Tom are still in the car. They freeze at the so of engines in the distance. The sounds fade. Tom looks ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I wonder whose car this is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen plucks some cassette tapes out of the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, whoever it is, he listens to  Pat Benatar, Eddie Money and the  soundtrack to "Footloose."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? (looks at tapes) Hold on... (looks around car) ...I think this is my car from high  school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen laughs. Just then...

dialogues.speaker: THE CAR
dialogues.text: Gets caught on something and stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like we get out here. (Karen hesitates) Come on -- I told your father I'd  have you home by ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen grins. Just then...

dialogues.speaker: A TRANSFORMER
dialogues.text: down the street explodes.

dialogues.speaker: TOM AND KAREN
dialogues.text: Hear a sparking sound and look over to see...

dialogues.speaker: A TRANSFORMER
dialogues.text: On a telephone/power pole close to them. Rain hits it, ca the sparking sound. The floodwater is inching up the pole toward it. The water will reach the transformer in a matter of secon And while they're staring at that...

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER TRANSFORMER
dialogues.text: At the end of the street explodes as water hits it.

dialogues.speaker: TOM AND KAREN
dialogues.text: Look around -- what to do? Tom points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They climb out of the car and start swimming toward a hou

dialogues.speaker: THE TRANSFORMER
dialogues.text: Water is three inches from the transformer; two inches...

dialogues.speaker: TOM AND KAREN
dialogues.text: Swimming as hard as they can.

dialogues.speaker: THE TRANSFORMER
dialogues.text: One inch from the water...

dialogues.speaker: TOM AND KAREN
dialogues.text: Reach the house. They pull themselves up onto a televisio antenna/ladder running up the side of the house. Karen's  feet are still in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your feet up!

dialogues.speaker: THE TRANSFORMER
dialogues.text: The water is about to touch. There's a sizzling sound.

dialogues.speaker: TOM AND KAREN
dialogues.text: They heave a huge sigh of relief -- but then Tom realizes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: antenna/ladder) It's metal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom pushes Karen over onto a window ledge. Then, just as  Tom's about to step over...

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Comes screaming in on the jet-ski. He dives off the jetsk gets a hold of Tom and pulls him under.

dialogues.speaker: KENNY AND TOM
dialogues.text: Surface. Kenny is stronger and he has Tom in a tight grip One problem -- Kenny doesn't know the danger they're in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've gotta --!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny shoves Tom underwater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEY! I GOT HIM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom comes up, looks over at...

dialogues.speaker: THE TRANSFORMER
dialogues.text: The sizzling is getting louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to --!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny dunks Tom again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I GOT HIM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom grabs Kenny's arms and pulls himself up fast.

dialogues.speaker: KENNY AND TOM
dialogues.text: Tom's head comes out of the water and slams into Kenny's  chin. Kenny is stunned. Tom gets free of his grasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom does the backstroke, pulling hard toward Karen.

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Still stunned, finally hears the sizzling and looks over  at...

dialogues.speaker: THE TRANSFORMER
dialogues.text: The water touches the outer casing of the transformer.

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Starts swimming fast toward...

dialogues.speaker: TOM AND KAREN
dialogues.text: Karen grabs Tom's arm and Tom gets a hold of the windowsi and pulls himself up.

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Grabs onto...

dialogues.speaker: THE TV ANTENNA
dialogues.text: And starts pulling himself out of the water.

dialogues.speaker: THE TRANSFORMER
dialogues.text: Explodes.

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Feels pretty pleased with himself until...

dialogues.speaker: THE TV ANTENNA
dialogues.text: Starts dancing with electricity and...

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Is hit by the voltage and his teeth clamp shut and his bo goes rigid and his clothes explode in flames.

dialogues.speaker: TOM AND KAREN
dialogues.text: Look away.

dialogues.speaker: THE WATER
dialogues.text: Dead fish start floating to the surface.

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Is fried, smoking. He falls off the TV antenna and hits t water with a loud and ugly hiss. He floats away, his body shaking spasmodically.

dialogues.speaker: TOM AND KAREN
dialogues.text: Tom hears an engine approaching. He looks around, then sm the window with his elbow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The window glass tumbles in. Tom reaches in, undoes the l and slides up the window. He climbs in, straddling the wi sill. The camera moves down Tom's leg to show...

dialogues.speaker: A WOLF TRAP
dialogues.text: Laying on the floor, just below the window.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Is oblivious. He starts to put his foot down into the tra Just then he knocks...

dialogues.speaker: A POTTED CACTUS
dialogues.text: Off the windowsill. It falls straight down into...

dialogues.speaker: THE WOLF TRAP
dialogues.text: Hitting the trigger. The jaws snap, obliterating the cact

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ!

dialogues.speaker: A SHOTGUN BARREL
dialogues.text: Snaps into view, pointing right at Tom's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You so much as breathe funny and  your head is going back out that  window without you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim drives the boat down the street. Mr. Mehlor is scanni the water with a flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim! Over there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim looks over to see...

dialogues.speaker: THE JET-SKI
dialogues.text: Floating in the water. And not far from it is...

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Still twitching.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doreen holds the shotgun on Tom and Karen as they move aw from the window, hands raised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real slow now. Like you were in a  big jar of molasses. That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hear footsteps coming down old wood stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doreen? You haven't killed anybody,  have you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got everything under control,  Henry. You go back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Doreen, you caught a whole  gang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and Mr. Mehlor pull Kenny into the ski-boat. Kenny is shivering. Part of his hair has been burned away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, God, it hurts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
