dialogues.text: You're gonna be okay, Ken. Mr. Mehlor  knows these things and he thinks  you're gonna be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mehlor looks at Jim. Mr. Mehlor knows these things an he thinks Kenny is going to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It hurts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you, Mr. Mehlor? Don't you  think Kenny's gonna be okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Kenny. You're gonna be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, I can't stop shivering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mehlor moves aside. Jim puts his arms around Kenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you didn't want me to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kidding? We couldn't've done  anything without you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad'd sure be pissed off, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dad'd just want you to lay still  while we got you some help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- hey the pain's goin'. (relief) Oh, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up at Jim and grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you said I was gonna be okay, I  thought you were just shittin' me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? You gotta trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny's shivering stops. It stops because he's dead. Jim  slowly lets go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry and Doreen have brought everything into their attic a TV, some silver and china, bowling trophies. A Coleman  lantern lights the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Well, isn't that just wonderful! Now  these bastards are gonna want to  kill us, too! Why the hell did you  have to come to this house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We thought it was empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? The house next door  is empty. So whaddya say we go back  downstairs and you two keep moving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are not going to send these people  out to the wolves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, we're not, are we? Then what's  your plan, General Schwartzkopf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I -- I just don't think --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. I have to go anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at him, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The National Guard'll be at the truck  in about fifteen minutes. I'm gonna  go wait for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't swim that far in fifteen  minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He could take our boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tom) I'll go get it ready for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry, he is not taking our boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry ignores Doreen. He pushes the attic stairs down, he down them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabs TV; to Tom) Here. You want a TV too? How about  some china? Maybe our silver? (sets TV down) Henry! Henry, you leave the boat  where it is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doreen heads off down the stairs. Tom starts down the sta stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen? (she looks at him) I'm Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch yourself, Tom. I really don't  wanna have to save your life again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom nods and goes down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry stands on the roof of the back porch, steadying a s rowboat as Tom gets in. Doreen nags from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You give away our only boat in the  middle of a flood. You are a genius,  Henry. A goddamn genius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers to Henry,  re: Doreen) You wanna come with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry looks at Tom, entertaining the notion...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Henry, what are you waiting  for -- a kiss goodbye? Get back in  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry sighs and lets go of the boat. Tom rows off.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: We see him in silhouette, crossing the gap between two ho

dialogues.speaker: JIM AND HIS MEN
dialogues.text: Are watching, from the shadows on the dark side of the st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we just get him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If our resourceful young friend hears  us coming, he'll electrocute us or  sink us or one of you'll shoot him.  Besides... (glances at watch) ...I know where he's going. What I'd  like to know is where he came from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff sits in his boat, moored to the wall of sandb around the church. Wayne's boat is tied up next to it. Th floodwater is trickling over the top of the wall. The gas powered pumps inside the wall are keeping the waters at b

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE AND PHIL
dialogues.text: Come out of the front doors of the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom rows up to the truck and "Welcome" sign. His flashlig shows just the top of the truck and sign. Tom looks at hi watch, ties the rowboat to the sign, jumps into the water A few moments pass, then Tom surfaces, holding a shotgun. Then he senses something behind him and turns to see...

dialogues.speaker: A COW
dialogues.text: Floating in the water, tongue out, eyes glassy.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Kicks away, horrified. And then he hears an engine. He lo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim's ski-boat is coming over the water. The engine cuts and the ski-boat drifts, a hundred feet from Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) Son, before you go underwater and do  something tricky, there's something  I'd like you to see!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flashlight comes on, the beam swivels, illuminating...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY AND DOREEN
dialogues.text: Standing in the ski-boat, blinking in the light.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Slumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I know it's your job to protect  that money, and maybe you'd even be  foolish enough to give your life for  it. The question is, are you willing  to give their lives for it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim puts a pistol to Doreen's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop the gun and get into the boat.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Thinks for a second, then throws the shotgun away and pul himself into the rowboat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent choice.

dialogues.speaker: TOM, JIM, HENRY AND DOREEN
dialogues.text: As Tom and Jim call to each other across the water, Doree goes at Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take you to the money, but you  gotta let them go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you're proud of yourself,  Henry Sears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it'd be best if --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you not to give him the goddamn  boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doreen, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it'd be best if we all stayed  together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say all you want is the money?  Prove it. Let them go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if that's --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could be safe in our home instead  of out here in a boat with these low- life scumbags!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a look at  Doreen, nods to Mr.  Mehlor) Let 'em go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff, Wayne and Phil motor past the statue. Wayne driving his boat; Phil is with the Sheriff. The water is to the General's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom helps Henry and Doreen over into the rowboat. As he d his face comes close to Henry's for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whisper) Karen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes head, whispers) In the attic. They never saw her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen swims down the center of the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is in the ski-boat with Jim. He looks out at...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY AND DOREEN
dialogues.text: As Henry rows them off into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappearing in dark) Faster, Henry! The bastards might  change their minds! Stop lily- dipping  and move it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry starts to turn the boat around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna row back there and see if  he'll shoot you. Or me. Fine either  way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to get us out of here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course, I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then shut the fuck up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry turns the boat around and rows off. Doreen is silen

dialogues.speaker: JIM'S SKI-BOAT
dialogues.text: Jim shakes his head. Tom looks at Ray, coughing and at Ke dead. Tom doesn't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only thing I want to hear from  you is where the money is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff and Wayne are motoring fast down a street, th Sheriff leading. The Sheriff sees something in the water front of him. He curses and throttles down fast.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Is in the water, exhausted and cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim pilots the ski-boat into the cemetery. All are aghast

dialogues.speaker: A DOZEN CASKETS
dialogues.text: Are floating in the water. Half of them have drifted up  against the fence; the others are headed that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder where they think they're  going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This happened in a flood in Georgia.  The ground gets soggy, and the caskets  are air-tight -- anyone who hasn't  been planted too long just pops up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You teach your students stuff like  that? No wonder they kicked you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't teach my students anything  at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tom) Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard to tell now with the water  so deep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim cocks the hammer on his pistol. Tom gets the hint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's down there a little further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim nods, gives the engine some juice and they move on.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Takes a quick look at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Sees Tom looking at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen is in the Sheriff's boat, wearing Phil's jacket, tr to warm up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom went off in their rowboat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Phil) It's Tom now. Looks like you lost  out, pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where was he going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to the armored truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim throttles down the ski-boat engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... no. A little farther --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not coming, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom looks over at Jim, pretending to be confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The National Guard. They're not  coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you've been trying to stall  until they show up, but they're not  coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause as he realizes) Oh, God. You intercepted Charlie's  call, then you called them off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, son, I didn't call them off.  They never were coming. We didn't  "intercept" Charlie's call. He called  us direct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And on Tom's look of disbelief...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hank is on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to help you, Sheriff, but I  can't leave! If the water goes over  the top again it's bye-bye, dam! Bye- bye, town! In fact, I could use a  little help up here myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff is in his boat; Wayne is back in his own. The Sheriff is on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hank, remember when Mike Crane holed  up in Jack Finch's barn and said he  was gonna burn it down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I was the one who got the dumb  son-of-a-bitch to come out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. And before you went in, I  deputized you, you dumb son-of-a- bitch! So when I say get down here,  it's not a request, it's an order.  So get down here! Now! I won't need  you for long. And bring your gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were gonna hit you just before  you got on the Interstate, but then  you got stuck so we had to change  our plans and take you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. This is all bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew Charlie when we were both  working construction for the Johnstown  company. His middle name was McCarthy  because his parents loved Charlie  McCarthy on the radio. His wife's  name was Mary. She died of a heart- attack last year. He has a daughter  and a son, both grown with children  of their own. I'm afraid I don't  know the names of the grandchildren.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom looks down, not wanting to believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else do I know...? Oh, yes. I  know Uncle Charlie was trying to  steer his favorite nephew away from  a life of crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom suddenly lunges for Jim. Ray yanks Tom back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you shoot him? Kill Charlie  and you get to keep another share?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, That was an accident. Ken shot  him. (eyes Kenny sadly) I never told him Charlie was on my  side. Ken liked to talk. (shakes head) He shouldn't've been here. But his  dad asked me to watch over him. I  guess I didn't do the best job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Jim. I hate to interrupt  and all, but could we just get the  money and get the hell out of here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods; to Tom) I'm gonna ask you one more time. And  before you think of bullshitting me  again, keep in mind I have had a  very frustrating night. And while I  know I'll never get the money if I  kill you, it's getting to the point  where I just don't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim casually aims his gun at Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you where it is. But it's  not going to do you any good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim arches an eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard may not be coming, but  someone else sure as hell is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the controls of his boat, moving fast, sprayed by rain Karen and Phil are in the back of the boat. Wayne is clos behind in his boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take my chances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom pauses, looks over to...

dialogues.speaker: THE CRYPT
dialogues.text: Just the top of it is visible. Two more COFFINS float nea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim steers the ski-boat over, hands Tom a flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, go get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom climbs over the edge of the ski-boat and into the wat He turns on the flashlight and drops below the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyeing Tom in water) "At night we'd go down to the river  and into the river we'd dive." (off Jim and Mehlor's  looks) Springsteen, "The River." I'm all  out of bible quotes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom shines his light on...

dialogues.speaker: THE CRYPT
dialogues.text: One end of a rope is tied to the crypt. The other end, cu and frayed, is suspended in the water, waving in the curr

dialogues.speaker: ON THE WATER
dialogues.text: Jim watches Tom's light rise. Tom comes up fast, takes a  breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smug) Looks like somebody beat you to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh for Christs -- I'm gonna shoot  him, Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray grabs pistol in his belt. Before he can pull it out,  holes puff out of his chest, followed by blood and then t sound of the rifle-shots. Ray tumbles into the water. A h second later there's...

dialogues.speaker: HAIL OF BULLETS
dialogues.text: Ripping into the ski-boat, water, trees, crypt.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF'S BOAT, WAYNE'S BOAT
dialogues.text: Are outside the fence, a hundred feet from the crypt. PUS IN FAST on...

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF
dialogues.text: To the rescue. He and Wayne and Phil fire their guns.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Ducks underwater.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Pulls his pistol, returns fire.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MEHLOR
dialogues.text: Opens fire with a shotgun, shooting wild, yelling. Then h hit and knocked out of the boat, dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! You'll hit Tom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff stops shooting, yells at the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold your fire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne and Phil stop shooting.

dialogues.speaker: BY THE CRYPT
dialogues.text: Tom is holding onto a coffin, out of view of the Sheriff. hears a rush of bubbles and turns as...

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Comes to the surface, breathing deep.

dialogues.speaker: JIM'S GUN
dialogues.text: Comes out of the water fast and the barrel goes to Tom's  forehead.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF'S BOAT
dialogues.text: There's an adrenal fire in the Sheriff's eyes. He starts boat forward, Wayne following. Their lights find...

dialogues.speaker: JIM'S BOAT
dialogues.text: No sign of life. Then there's a sound and the lights swee over to find...

dialogues.speaker: JIM AND TOM
dialogues.text: Climbing up on top of the mostly-submerged crypt. Jim is  behind Tom with his gun to Tom's head.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Stops his boat. Wayne stops, too. They are thirty yards f Jim and Tom.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN AND TOM
dialogues.text: A look passes between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sheriff) Now, sir, I can imagine you'd love  nothing more than to shoot me, but I  caution you -- in order to do that,  you're gonna have to shoot through  young Tom here.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Thinks for a second, then shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Realizes what is about to happen.

dialogues.speaker: TOM AND JIM
dialogues.text: Also clue in, but before they can move...

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Squeezes the trigger as...

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Hits the gun with her arm.

dialogues.speaker: THE RIFLE
dialogues.text: Fires.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: is grazed in the arm by the bullet.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Smacks Karen hard with his rifle and she tumbles out of t boat, unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: TOM AND JIM
dialogues.text: Throw themselves back off the crypt as...

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF AND WAYNE
dialogues.text: Empty their guns in their direction.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Returns fire, shooting blindly over the top of the crypt.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Reaches for Karen, floating limp in the water, but...

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Is closer. He grabs Karen and pulls her into his boat, th grins at Phil.

dialogues.speaker: TOM AND JIM
dialogues.text: Are behind the crypt. Tom holds his bleeding arm. Jim rel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that was unexpected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he the one you thought was coming  to your rescue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer from Tom, but the answer is clear.

dialogues.speaker: WITH THE SHERIFF AND HIS MEN
dialogues.text: The Sheriff and Wayne reload.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone mind telling me what the hell  is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff, Wayne and Phil turn to see...

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: In his boat, right behind them, all dressed up in hunting gear, rifle at the ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Hank. That money I told you  about? From the armored car? We're  gonna keep it. Three million dollars.  Four ways. (shoots at crypt) Seven fifty apiece. You okay with  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hank is stunned. He doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hank? You okay with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven hundred and fifty thousand  dollars? (beat, grins) Damn straight I'm okay with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grumbling, re: Hank) Don't see what we needed him for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I guess you've never been hunting  with Hank. (to Hank) We got two behind that crypt. Get  'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hank nods. He motions for Wayne to go one way; he'll go t other. They start off. A blind shot comes from Jim behind the crypt. The Sheriff shoots back. Phil finally musters the courage to say something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'm not okay with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on now, Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna kill people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're looters, Phil! They come and  steal from an armored truck in our  town -- they're looters. (fires two shots)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Tom? What about Karen?  They're not looters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they're witnesses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff fires off a flurry of bullets.

dialogues.speaker: TOM AND JIM
dialogues.text: Behind the crypt, bullets winging by. Jim looks over, see

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Motor into view.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Opens fire.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Shoots back.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Flattens against the crypt, then turns to see...

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Coming into view on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Looks at Jim, sees he's occupied in the fight with Hank.  Then he sees...

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Floating in the water, dead, pistol still jammed in his p

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Thinks, decides, and reaches out for Ray.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Shooting at Hank. He hears gunfire from Wayne and is abou to swivel to shoot in that direction when he hears a gun  firing from right next to him. He turns to see...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Shooting back at Wayne with Ray's gun.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Pulls back out of the line of fire.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Curses and pulls back, too.

dialogues.speaker: TOM AND JIM
dialogues.text: Exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez, Phil, I always thought Wayne  was the stupid one. Read my lips. (slowly) Three million dollars. Look at it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff reaches down into a forward storage area of t boat and pulls back a tarp revealing the bags of money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of those bags are gonna be  yours, Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But -- but -- you're the Sheriff!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff rips his badge off and throws it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the what?

dialogues.speaker: TOM AND JIM
dialogues.text: Jim looks at Tom, then hands Tom his pistol. Tom doesn't  know what Jim's doing. Jim slips beneath the water.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Whistles and gets Wayne's attention. He motions Wayne to it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For twenty years you've been --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For twenty years I've been eating  shit, breakfast, lunch and dinner.  Well, tonight I'm changing the menu!  From now on everything I eat is gonna  be shit-free!

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THE CRYPT
dialogues.text: Tom is looking for Jim, to see what he's doing. And then.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE AND HANK
dialogues.text: Come around on both sides.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Starts shooting at them with the two pistols.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE AND HANK
dialogues.text: Pull back. As they go...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Sees...

dialogues.speaker: KAREN'S ARM
dialogues.text: Draped over the side of Wayne's boat.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Takes another shot at Hank but stops firing at Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: JIM'S SKI-BOAT
dialogues.text: Jim's hand appears over the gunwale. He reaches in and  grabs...

dialogues.speaker: MR. MEHLOR'S PACK
dialogues.text: And pulls it out of the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I make it any clearer, Phil? Do  you want me to draw pictures?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil pulls out his revolver and points it at the Sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't let you do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh for -- (beat) Okay, Phil. But here's how it's gonna  go. I'm gonna hear one of two things  out of you. Either I'm gonna hear  you say you're in with us, or... (moves close to Phil's  gun) ...I'm gonna hear a bullet come out  of that gun and go into me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil is incredulous. The Sheriff weighs his hands like sc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (one hand) Seven hundred and fifty thousand  dollars or... (other hand) ...you kill me. Your choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff weighs the hands a couple more times. Phil sl lowers the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There we go.

dialogues.speaker: SOMETHING
dialogues.text: Flies through the air; lands in the water by the Sheriff. It's...

dialogues.speaker: MR. MEHLOR'S PACK
dialogues.text: And it starts sinking in the water.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THE CRYPT
dialogues.text: Tom sees...

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Haul himself into the ski-boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the boat!

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF, WAYNE AND HANK
dialogues.text: Start shooting at Jim in the ski-boat.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Sticks the shotgun over the gunwale and returns fire.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Starts swimming for the boat.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF, WAYNE AND HANK
dialogues.text: See Tom and start shooting at both he and Jim when...

dialogues.speaker: MR. MEHLOR'S PACK
dialogues.text: Explodes and...

dialogues.speaker: THE WATER
dialogues.text: Erupts in a huge geyser.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF, WAYNE, PHIL AND HANK
dialogues.text: Are knocked off their feet. The Sheriff, Phil and Hank ar thrown into the water. Their boats are rocked up and back and swamped with falling water.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Fires up his engine.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Is almost to the boat.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Gets to his knees in his boat and starts shooting.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Gets to Jim's boat and grabs onto it.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Cranks the throttle, and, dragging Tom, tears off under t hail of Wayne's bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jim races through the tombstones, barely missing  halfsubmerged stone crosses and crypt roofs.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Rams into one cross.

dialogues.speaker: HIS HANDS
dialogues.text: Start to slip from the boat.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Grabs Tom's hand and holds on as they shoot off across th water.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF, PHIL AND HANK
dialogues.text: Get back in the boats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim hauls Tom into the boat. Tom lays on the bottom, catc his breath. Blood is dripping down from his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, looks up at  Jim) You really want that money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim gives Tom a look -- of course he wants that money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause the only way you're ever gonna  see it is if you help me get Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Jim can answer, gunshots ring out behind them. The look back to see...

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF AND HIS MEN
dialogues.text: Coming after them in the three boats, shooting, closing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're too slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks, then:) Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim moves away from the wheel, giving it to Tom. Tom gets and takes over. Jim bends and picks up...

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Lifeless and limp.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Looks at Kenny for a moment, then pushes his body overboa

dialogues.speaker: WITH THE SHERIFF AND HIS MEN
dialogues.text: Flying over the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They see a body tumble out of the ski-boat.

dialogues.speaker: WITH JIM AND TOM
dialogues.text: Jim looks back, following Kenny with his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and Tom make the turn onto Main Street. They look bac as...

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF AND HIS MEN
dialogues.text: Come around the corner, two hundred yards back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not going to catch us now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of the ski-boat, racing toward camera. As it gets closer, the camera BOOMS DOWN underwater to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: THE STATUE
dialogues.text: The sword tip just below the surface. THE SKI-BOAT There's a jarring metal on metal clank as the sword tip s into the propeller.

dialogues.speaker: JIM AND TOM
dialogues.text: Are thrown forward.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Slams head-first into the dash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The propeller has stopped.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Looks back to see that...

dialogues.speaker: THE OUTBOARD MOTOR
dialogues.text: Has almost been ripped from its moorings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so maybe they are gonna catch  us now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer from Jim. Tom looks down.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Is laying on the deck, unconscious. Just then... BAM! BAM

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Has his rifle resting on his boat's windshield and is fir off a clip on automatic as he, Wayne and the Sheriff clos in.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Ducks down and tries to start the engine. No go. Again. I catches on the third try. Tom guns it and the boat tears  off.

dialogues.speaker: THE OUTBOARD ENGINE
dialogues.text: Is wobbling, vibrating.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Keeps up his stream of gunfire.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Stays down, driving blind, as the bullets fly in, blowing holes in the windshield. He looks at Jim, at the engine a curses. He steers the boat toward...

dialogues.speaker: THE CHURCH
dialogues.text: All lit-up, brilliant white in the darkness, a quarter-mi away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water is now over the sandbag wall. The first several feet of the church are flooded.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKI-BOAT
dialogues.text: Comes up fast. Tom grounds it on top of the sandbag wall. Tom hesitates for a half second before grabbing Jim and  pushing him out of the boat and into the water.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Hits the cold water and comes to, sputtering.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Grabs guns and ammo and jumps out of the boat and into th water. He lays a rifle on the top of the sandbag wall and fires off a clip.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF, HANK AND WAYNE
dialogues.text: Jim's bullets plug into their boats. They circle back.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE CHURCH
dialogues.text: Tom pushes Jim, still groggy, into the flooded church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom shuts the door. He piles the weapons on a shelf. He s Jim touch his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne and Hank are alongside the Sheriff, engines idling they look at the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, to Hank) Then go get some bottles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hank nods, guns his engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hank) Wait -- what about the dam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said if it goes it'll wipe out  the town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck the town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hank nods in agreement and takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and Tom are by one of the stained glass windows, look out through a pale-colored pane at the Sheriff and his me across the street. They watch Hank race off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he have the girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes head) She's in the small boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom touches the wound on his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, I'm gonna get hepatitis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hepatitis, hell. You probably already  got cholera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom gives Jim a look then starts for the back of the chur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a back room. (touches wound) Maybe they've got something I can  use on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been in here before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bad memory) Oh, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water is starting to go over the top again. It pours down sheets over the face of the dam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim is by the window, looking out at the Sheriff and Wayn across the street in the shadows. He turns as...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Enters from the back. He's got a bottle of rubbing alcoho and a towel. He splashes some of the alcohol on the towel then touches it to his wound. It hurts like a sonofabitch After a beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, has this all gone pretty much  how you thought it would?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim turns on Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything would have gone fine if  you'd've just walked away from the  truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah? Well, everything would've  gone even better if you hadn't decided  to rob the damn truck in the first  place!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim looks away. After another silence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Charlie have cancer or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean why was he doing this? (thinks, shrugs) No cancer. (beat) Didn't you ever think about taking  the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come now. A man who used to make his  living fencing hot jackhammers never  thought about what he'd do with three  million dollars?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to disappoint you. (beat) What are you gonna do with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As little as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence for a few moments, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's this small country in Central  America, on the Atlantic side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know where Belize is. What about  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They speak English and the dollar  goes a long way. Beautiful beaches;  friendly people. And they've got  liberal banking laws. Very liberal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you didn't think about taking  that money at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (busted) You can't ride in the truck and not  think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure. And I guess that's pretty  much how it started with Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom thinks, nods and presses the towel to his wound again

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne is thinking about something. He makes a decision an flicks on his engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got too many bodies with bullets  in 'em. (nods at Karen) I'm gonna put her in her house, make  it look like she fell down the stairs  and drowned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you touch her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saving her life... Hmm... You know,  that might have actually gotten you  laid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, for Christsakes, just dump her  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a few minutes before Hank  gets back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just dump her here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne ignores the Sheriff and motors off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne! Goddamnit, we've gotta get  them outta there! Wayne!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Wayne keeps going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom watches Wayne drive off with Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Where's he going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom grabs a rifle, frustrated and angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hank motors up to the Sheriff and Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Wayne going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a date. You all set?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't we gonna wait for Wayne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can get started without him, the  dumb shit. He won't be long. Besides,  we got Phil. Phil's gonna earn his  money on this, aren't you Phil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil looks scared shitless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water continues to pour over the top. CLOSE ON CONCRETE Chunks of cement are starting to wash away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom finishes reloading a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What -- you're gonna swim after her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom doesn't answer. He moves toward the front door. Jim c him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't gonna help her by getting  shot. He's gone and you don't know  where.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff knows. I think maybe  I'll go ask him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be dead before you get over  the sandbags. (beat) Look, he'll be coming for us. You  can ask him then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim sees something out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he doesn't come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't worry about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom sees what Jim sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff, Phil and Hank are heading toward the church, flaming Molotov cocktails in their hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff, Phil and Hank heave the flaming Molotov  cocktails.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROOF
dialogues.text: The bottles hit, explode. Sheets of fire rain down the ro

dialogues.speaker: ONE BOTTLE
dialogues.text: Smashes through a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Jim duck down as...

dialogues.speaker: THE BOTTLE
dialogues.text: Flies across the inside of the church and smashes against wall, sending sheets of fire down the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roof is on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Modest, two-story, on a side street. The front door is op the boat tied up outside. There's a light on in the front hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen is unconscious. Wayne has her laying on the stairs  leading up from the entry area to the second floor. There three feet of water in the house. Karen's legs are in the water. Her hands are handcuffed to a railing attached to wall, running up the stairs. Wayne stands over Karen, pat her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wakey-wakey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen stirs, then starts slipping back into unconsciousne so Wayne splashes her face with water. Karen comes to,  sputtering. Her eyes focus. She looks up at Wayne. Wayne  grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Penthouse: I always thought  your letters were fake, until the  wildest thing happened to me. I'm a  policeman in a small town. In the  middle of the big flood last year, I  was patrolling the streets in a boat,  feeling kind of sorry for myself --  'cause it was my birthday and all --  when I saw the front door to a house  was open. I pulled my gun -- afraid  it might be looters. Imagine my  surprise when, instead of a looter,  I find a young woman handcuffed to  the railing of her stairs. Her name  was Karen, and ever since she came  back from college she'd made it clear  she was too good for any of us local  folk. Now here she was, in handcuffs!  I said, "What the heck is going on  here, ma'am?" And she said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen says nothing. Wayne leans in close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Wayne, but I'm not playing a  part in your sick little play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne pulls his gun, puts it to Karen's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're perfect for the role. I suggest  you reconsider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or what? You'll kill me? You're gonna  do that anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might get clumsy. It might take a  while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you can hurt me. But it's  all going to be the same when I'm  dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne straightens up, looks at her, then launches back in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she said, "Happy Birthday, Wayne.  I've got something for you." Well,  I'm not stupid. I knew what she wanted  to give me and I knew she wanted to  give it bad, so I --

dialogues.speaker: THE OVERHEAD LIGHT
dialogues.text: Sparks and goes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks up at light) That won't do. Man's gotta see what  he's doing. 'Scuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne heads off for the kitchen. The second he's gone...

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Raises her hips and digs a hand into her pocket and pulls out her Swiss Army knife. She pries open the big blade. S hears Wayne sloshing back toward her. She gets back into position Wayne left her in as...

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Re-enters carrying two burning candles in candle-holders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got the candles. All's we need is  a cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sets the candles down on a dry step above Karen's head He leans in close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mood lighting. You in the mood yet? (no answer from Karen;  back into Penthouse  letter) And then she said, "My present's  ready and waiting. All's you gotta  do is unwrap it."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne reaches into the water, undoes Karen's rain pants,  yanks off her shoes, then pulls off her pants. He throws  them over the banister. Karen remains passive, blank. Way takes off his holster; hangs it on the banister. Then he  pushes his pants down to his ankles. His shirttail is lon enough so that we don't have to see his wretched little  pecker. He climbs on top of Karen in the water, brings hi face close to hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was cold and rainy that birthday  night, and all I wanted was to get  someplace warm and dry. As it turned  out, what I really wanted was  something warm and wet. Wayne grins  and closes for a kiss and...

dialogues.speaker: KAREN'S HAND
dialogues.text: Moves fast with the knife and...

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE'S EYES
dialogues.text: Pop open wide.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: His head jerks back. He tries to shout, but all that come out is an awful gurgle. He tries to push off Karen, but..

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Wraps her legs around him, holds him close, pinning him.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Finally breaks free. He tries to stop the bleeding with a hand, but the blood spurts through his fingers. He reache for his gun in his holster on the banister, but just as h grabs it...

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Lashes out of the water with her legs, kicking Wayne in t groin, pushing him back.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Tries to get his balance, but his feet can't move -- his  pants are around his ankles. He falls back into the water firing his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: BULLETS
dialogues.text: Blow chunks out of the wall next to Karen, hit the ceilin and...

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Is floating on his back, trying to lift the pistol, but h strength is fading fast. He gets off one last shot and...

dialogues.speaker: THE CANDLE
dialogues.text: Nearest Karen is blown to pieces.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: The gun drops into the water. No more shots. No more life He floats, pants around his ankles, covered in blood, dea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy Birthday, Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The church roof is on fire.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF, PHIL AND HANK
dialogues.text: Are across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and Tom hear a creaking and look up.

dialogues.speaker: THE CEILING
dialogues.text: The fire has eaten holes in the roof. Embers come down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff is getting very agitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not coming out, Hank!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire's not catching. The rain's  too --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to get them! We have to kill  them! Do you understand? If they're  not dead, we got jack shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small chunk of burning ceiling drops down. Jim and Tom  look up. Just then...

dialogues.speaker: BRIGHT LIGHT
dialogues.text: Floods into the church through...

dialogues.speaker: THE STAINED GLASS WINDOWS
dialogues.text: Filling the church with a kaleidoscope of colors.

dialogues.speaker: TOM AND JIM
dialogues.text: Look out the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God they're beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: THE STAINED GLASS WINDOWS
dialogues.text: Remain beautiful for a few more seconds until they shatte and blow inwards as...

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF'S BOAT AND HANK'S BOAT
dialogues.text: Come crashing through.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOATS
dialogues.text: Land, stop fast. The Sheriff's boat lands closer to the  pulpit; Hank's boat closer to the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF, HANK AND PHIL
dialogues.text: Look around. It's quiet for a moment. There's no sign of and Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen has her pants back on. She reaches out with one foo and hooks Wayne's holster off the banister. She flips it  through the air and catches it with her hands. She opens  little leather pockets -- mace, more bullets. No keys. Ka starts to panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There have to be keys. There --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees...

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Still floating on his back, still dead. She looks closer  at...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bunched around his ankles. And there, hanging from a belt loop is a ring of keys.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Reaches out with her foot for Wayne's pants. She can't re

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Is slowly drifting out the open door. Beyond the door, in the light of the streetlamp, the water is riffling, movin and Wayne is heading toward it.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Slides down further on the stairs, into the water, then s

dialogues.speaker: HANDCUFFS AND RAILING
dialogues.text: There are metal supports going from the railing to the wa every three feet. Karen is prevented from going any furth down the stairs by one of these supports.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Reaches out with a foot, straining, stretching her body,  almost dislocating her shoulder and...

dialogues.speaker: HER FOOT
dialogues.text: Just barely touches one of Wayne's feet, but then Wayne's foot slips away and...

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Can only watch as...

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Drifts out the door and is pulled away by the current.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water is cascading over the top of the dam. Chunks of con are washing away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff, Phil and Wayne scan the water, looking for  movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they?! Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking up through a tangle of floating pews at the waver silhouettes of the boats and the men in them against the  burning timbers above.

dialogues.speaker: TWO PISTOLS
dialogues.text: Come into view, pointed up through the water.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE WATER
dialogues.text: The Sheriff, Phil and Hank have let down their guard for second when there's a series of dull, muted clacks from  underwater as...

dialogues.speaker: BULLETS
dialogues.text: Come streaking out of the water, winging by them, pluggin into the boats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim fires the pistols, the bullets' bubble streaks knifin up through the water.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF, PHIL AND HANK
dialogues.text: hit the deck in their boats, returning fire over the gunw

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Surfaces over by the stairs up to the balcony, gasping fo air. He runs for the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: BLAZING TIMBERS
dialogues.text: Start to fall from the burning roof frame, hitting the wa with loud sizzling hisses.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF, PHIL AND HANK
dialogues.text: Turn to shoot at tom through the dropping flaming debris.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Disappears up the stairs, the bullets just missing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim runs out of bullets. He's long since run out of air. drops his guns and swims under the pews.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Looks up, realizing that Tom will be able to shoot down o him. He reverses his boat fast under the balcony as...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Shoots down from the balcony, blowing a chunk out of the  prow of Hank's boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water is up to Karen's chin. Her hands are working  frantically beneath the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's using the tip of the knife blade to unscrew the scr holding the support to the railing. She's on the last one The blade slips, misses, gets a quarter turn, another qua turn...

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Spits out the water that spills into her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another quarter-turn and the screw is loose enough to tur by hand.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Holds her breath with the water touching her nose. She ge the screw loose, pulls up on the railing and pulls the  handcuff through the gap between the support and the rail

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff turns to Phil and nods re: Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take care of him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff aims at the balcony as Phil scans the water,  looking for Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim pulls an electrical cord out of a wall socket.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BALCONY
dialogues.text: Tom ducks down as the Sheriff's bullets start plugging th the wood front of the balcony. Tom moves away from the bu strikes, splashing through the water in the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: BALCONY FLOOR
dialogues.text: As BANG BANG BANG -- bullets start shooting up from below

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Is firing up at Tom through the floor of the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Jumps back, startled, looking down at...

dialogues.speaker: THE BALCONY FLOOR
dialogues.text: Holes explode in the floor, sending up small geysers of w The water then starts whirlpooling down through the holes

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Moves back from hank's advancing bullet holes.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Keeps firing.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Is caught between Hank's bullets and the Sheriff's bullet So he racks a load in the shotgun and dives backwards off the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Is still shooting up as...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Arcs off the balcony, firing the shotgun under the balcon at Hank.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Dives to the floor of his boat as Tom's shotgun blasts bl plate-sized holes in the church doors.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Lands in the water and goes under.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF AND PHIL
dialogues.text: Look for Tom in the water.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Starts to get up from the bottom of his boat, searching f a clip for his gun.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Sees Tom's shape in the water and is about to shoot when.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Jumps up out of the water with the electrical cord. He to a loop of the cord around the Sheriff's neck and pulls,  yanking the Sheriff out of the boat.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Comes out of the water, aiming his shotgun at...

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Who is aiming his pistol at Tom. Phil freezes.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF AND JIM
dialogues.text: Struggle in the water. Jim pulls the cord tightly around Sheriff's neck as the Sheriff tries to get a shot off at he can't get the barrel pointed at Jim.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Fumbles with the bullet clip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Phil) Kill him!

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Turns his shotgun on Hank and pulls the trigger -- click. oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill him!

dialogues.speaker: TOM AND PHIL
dialogues.text: Exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Slams the clip into his gun and levels it at Tom.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Points his gun at Hank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! We can't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG! and hank shoots Phil. Phil pitches back out of the  Sheriff's boat.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Lands between Jim and the Sheriff, knocking them apart.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Is free of Jim's grasp. He shakes off the electrical cord and turns to shoot...

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Who moves a little faster. He grabs Phil's pistol and put it to the Sheriff's head before the Sheriff can bring his gun around.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Draws a bead on Jim and is about to shoot when...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Comes out of the water on the other side of Hank's boat. pushes down hard on the side of the boat.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Is rocked back, thrown off balance. He starts to spin and bring his gun around when...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Swings with the shotgun, catching...

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: In the side of the head. Hank crumples and falls into the water, taking his rifle with him.

dialogues.speaker: JIM AND THE SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Jim nods at the Sheriff's rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the boat.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Hesitates, then tosses his rifle into the boat.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Grabs Hank's rifle and aims it at the Sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Karen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen undoes a last screw in a metal support. She pulls the handcuff through the gap between the suppor and railing. She's at the top of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: THE END OF THE RAILING
dialogues.text: Curves and goes into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Tugs at the railing, tries rocking it up and down. It doe budge. She starts chipping at the plaster with the knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I am really beginning to hate  fine craftsmanship.

dialogues.speaker: THE WATER
dialogues.text: It's up to her chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They went back to her house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's her house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just then they all hear something truly ominous -- a  siren pierces the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reacts to the siren -- uh-oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The siren wails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in God's name is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (woozy but okay) It's topped out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much time we got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How should I know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an old dam! Not long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tom) Then I'd say you boys better drop  your guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the deal! You let me and Hank  go -- with a few of these bags --  and I'll tell you where to find Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Sheriff) Get out of the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim turns to look at Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only way you're gonna find  her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only a couple of bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I thought --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't know what you thought  but I told you, I'm here for the  money; that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom doesn't know what to do. The Sheriff looks pretty ple with himself. He might just get out of this. And then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lives on Boyd Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all look over at...

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Alive, but barely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three over. Two-story, blue shutters.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Looks at Jim, disappointed, angry, then hurries to Hank's boat.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Climbs into the Sheriff's boat.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Climbs into Hank's boat. He starts the engine, looks down at...

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Floating in the water, dying. A brief look between them,  then...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Drives the boat out through a shattered window.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Pushes the Sheriff out of the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large V is being cut in the top of the dam by the ragin water.

dialogues.speaker: A QUARTER-MILE AWAY
dialogues.text: Looking back at the dam. The line of lights on top of the dam start to fall over, then go dark, snuffed out by an u force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim keeps his gun leveled at the Sheriff and Hank, standi in the water, as he pulls the money bags up from the forw hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you just gonna kill me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord knows I should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim opens a money bag and smiles at what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen tilts her head back to keep her lips and nose above water. And then she hears a window smash. She turns as...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Wades in along the upper hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm guessing you can't get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm handcuffed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom reaches into the water for the railing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The railing's bolted to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the kitchen. In the tall cupboard  beside the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then they hear a sound more ominous than the siren -- they hear the siren stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that good or bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, the Sheriff and Hank react to the silence. Jim looks off.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Drops underwater.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Turns back at the sound of the Sheriff going under.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff pulls up his pant leg.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Is aiming his gun at the water and is about to fire as...

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF'S HAND
dialogues.text: Comes out of the water shooting a pistol.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Is shot in the gut and the thigh and high on the chest an he stumbles back, bellowing, and falls out of the Sheriff boat and into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should've just killed me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom starts hyperventilating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dam's gone! You gotta go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes head) I owe you one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom breathes deep then ducks underwater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom flicks on his flashlight and starts swimming down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Watches Tom and his light get swallowed up in the murky w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil is grabbing for the Sheriff's boat as the Sheriff an Hank zoom out of the church, leaving him behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOOOO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff's boat comes onto Main Street, moving fast.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BOAT
dialogues.text: Hank is looking back, in the direction the flood will com

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta go faster!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff pushes Hank out of the boat.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Goes skipping over the water and slams into a streetlight post.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom swims down into the living room. His light shows a co chairs, TV set. Books and newspapers are suspended in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The damaged ski-boat that Jim and Tom took to the church slipped off the sandbag wall and is drifting. A peaceful  scene. But then, from the distance, comes a rushing roar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil hears the roar. He looks around, lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hank, groggy in the water, also hears the distant roar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roar is building, getting louder. Phil sees something the water and reaches for it, frantically. He gets it. It

dialogues.speaker: A BIBLE
dialogues.text: And he clutches it to his chest as...

dialogues.speaker: THE FLOOD
dialogues.text: Hits the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom swims into the kitchen. He looks for the tall cupboar by the fridge. He opens it.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CUPBOARD
dialogues.text: Hanging on a hook on the back wall is a saw. Tom grabs it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hank unwraps himself from around the lamp post. He looks  back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Streetlights in the distance, winking out one by one, mar the advance of the wall of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hank looks around for safety. He sees it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an alleyway.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Swims for the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roars through the town, pushing a rolling wave of debris, obliterating anything in its path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hank swims into the alley. Hank looks for something to cl up on, to hold onto. There's...

dialogues.speaker: FIRE ESCAPE LADDER
dialogues.text: At the end of the alley.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Swims for it. He hears the rushing roar of the advancing  flood. He expects the flood to blow by the end of the all Wrong.

dialogues.speaker: WALL OF WATER
dialogues.text: Comes into the alley, banking high on the far wall before coming down and barreling toward Hank. And what makes it  worse for Hank is that there's...

dialogues.speaker: A CAR
dialogues.text: At the front of the wave, being pushed by the water.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Dives clear just as...

dialogues.speaker: THE CAR
dialogues.text: Smashes into the wall, right where Hank had just been.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Relief in his eyes. He gets to the fire escape and is cli to safety when...

dialogues.speaker: PROPANE TANK
dialogues.text: Comes into the alley, rolling in the flood, spraying prop from a torn hose. It explodes.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Barely has time to scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is threading his belt through the handle of the saw t secure it. He gets it done and starts to swim out of the  kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO KAREN
dialogues.text: Just Karen's lips and nose are above water.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Tom is about to leave when everything starts to move --  rocking, from side to side, as if in a slow motion earthq Cupboards and the fridge open and bottles and food and pl tumble out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house has been hit by the flood. It's being pulled by the massive current, stretching overhead phone and power  lines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen hears the groaning, ripping as the house tears free from water and sewer lines. She's looking down for Tom wh there's a snap and the light above her goes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is carried on the current, turning in the water

dialogues.speaker: IN THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Tom watches, astounded, as the room starts to turn around him. He kicks fast for the door to...

dialogues.speaker: THE LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Tom swims in, fast, toward the stairs when...

dialogues.speaker: A WINDOW
dialogues.text: Caves in and...

dialogues.speaker: HUGE TREE BRANCH
dialogues.text: Smashes in, filling the room, blocking Tom's route to the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Tries to get through the tangle of branches and leaves, b can't. He swims over to another window and slides it up.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Keeps looking down for Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is impaled on a tree, the current sluicing arou it.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Surfaces near the side of the house, gasping. The current starts ripping him past the house. He swims as hard as he can back to the house, reaches out and grabs onto a gutte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen doesn't have much time left. The water is washing o her mouth and nose. And just as she's about to go under..

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Swims in with the saw. He starts sawing on the handrail.  Everything's going fine. And then...

dialogues.speaker: THE SAWBLADE
dialogues.text: Snaps.

dialogues.speaker: TOM AND KAREN
dialogues.text: Look at each other. Oh no. Karen's going under.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Sees something. He dives into the water.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Can only watch and wait. What's he doing? Oh, Jesus. And  then...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Surfaces, holding Wayne's pistol. He puts the mouth of th barrel to the handcuff chain, shields Karen's face, looks away and pulls the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water swirls through the branches of a half-submerged tree.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY AND DOREEN
dialogues.text: Are in the tree. Henry is either unconscious or dead. Dor cradles him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Henry. Forget that "Go to  the light" crap. Come back to me.  You're all I've got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Henry starts to come to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Henry. Thank God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time, when I say "Let's  evacuate," we're gonna evacuate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you say, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hugs him tight and after a beat he hugs her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Karen swim out of a second floor window, grab the rain gutter. Tom pulls himself onto the roof then grabs K and helps her up. They crawl until they're clear of the e Only the sloped roof of the house is visible in the swirl water. They are just catching their breath when they are by...

dialogues.speaker: BRIGHT WHITE LIGHT
dialogues.text: And they look to see...

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF
dialogues.text: In his boat, shining a searchlight on them with one hand, gun in the other. He starts shooting.

dialogues.speaker: TOM AND KAREN
dialogues.text: Tom pushes Karen toward the peak of the roof as the bulle plug in around them. Tom pushes Karen over the top then t and dives off the roof and into the water.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Hears an engine behind her and turns.

dialogues.speaker: A BOAT
dialogues.text: Racing toward the house. It's...

dialogues.speaker: THE SKI-BOAT
dialogues.text: And at the controls is...

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Barely alive.

dialogues.speaker: THE OUTBOARD MOTOR
dialogues.text: Is wobbling, vibrating at the back of the boat, almost lo from its moorings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees Karen, crouched below the peak of the house, a br light coming from the other side along with gunshots.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Pushes the throttle all the way forward.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKI-BOAT
dialogues.text: Shoots forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom swims hard toward the Sheriff's boat.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Is shooting down into the water at Tom's moving shape.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKI-BOAT
dialogues.text: With Jim at the wheel, comes racing straight toward the h

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Thinks he's going to turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No!

dialogues.speaker: THE SKI-BOAT
dialogues.text: Doesn't turn.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Rolls to the side, just getting clear as...

dialogues.speaker: THE SKI-BOAT
dialogues.text: Hits the sloping roof of Karen's house and ramps up it.

dialogues.speaker: THE OUTBOARD MOTOR
dialogues.text: Digs into the shingles of the roof and tears free from th back of the boat.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Hears the sound and looks up as...

dialogues.speaker: THE SKI-BOAT
dialogues.text: Comes over the peak of the roof.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Surfaces to see...

dialogues.speaker: THE SKI-BOAT
dialogues.text: Fly right over him, heading straight for...

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Who ducks down, just in time as...

dialogues.speaker: THE SKI-BOAT
dialogues.text: Misses him, landing just past him in the water.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Straightens up, grinning with glee that the boat missed h And then he hears a piercing whine coming from behind him He turns, just in time to see...

dialogues.speaker: THE OUTBOARD MOTOR
dialogues.text: Flipping end over end, propeller whirring, heading straig for him.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Starts to scream.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Looking over the peak of the roof in horror. She hears th Sheriff's scream and the scream of the propeller and then horrible ugly ripping and both screams stop.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF'S BOAT
dialogues.text: The Sheriff is gone. The side has been smashed out of the boat and the boat is flooding with water.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Is just some misshapen thing trailing red, floating in th water.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Tries to restart the ski-boat but it's dead. He slumps  forward.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Sees Jim slump against the side of the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom can tell Jim's anything but. Tom swims for the boat.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOAT
dialogues.text: Tom swims up, pulls himself in. He pulls Jim back off the controls, sees the blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God. We gotta get you to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim looks at Tom. Tom understands -- Jim's not going anyw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just saved our lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did? I just came for the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom looks at Jim -- he knows Jim's lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need any help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabs Tom's arm) No. Tell her to stay back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Karen) It's okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim lets go of Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to turn it in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to disappoint you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hell, then I guess I better  take it after all. I figure the  river'll carry me down to the Gulf  of Mexico. If I catch the right  currents, maybe I'll end up in...  Belize? (Tom nods) You come look me up. I'll buy you a  drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim grimaces as he's hit by a wave of pain. He looks away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom hesitates for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom turns and slides into the water and swims away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son, don't think too badly of your  Uncle Charlie. He always said you  were capable of remarkable things. (beat) He was right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a last look between Jim and Tom, then Tom swims a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) The rain's stopped. (breathes deep) The air after a rain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim slowly topples forward and is still.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Swims through the swirling current toward Karen's roof.

dialogues.speaker: JIM'S BOAT
dialogues.text: Sinks below the surface and is gone.

dialogues.speaker: TOM AND KAREN
dialogues.text: Karen is down at the water's edge with her arm extended t Tom. Tom grabs it, and as Karen pulls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen pulls Tom up onto scaffolding running along the edg of the new roof under construction. Tom holds a paper bag He's wearing work gear -- tool belt, work boots, etc. Tom looks at the work being done on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got a lot done today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's coming along. (re: bag) What'd you get?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbecue chicken from Lilly's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want some? I wish you'd told me.  I woulda got more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as they sit down and start to eat, the camera begins PULL BACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I talked to Mikey. He says the  flooring should be in by Friday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what he said last week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said if it wasn't here by Friday  at six that you were going to go  over and beat the crap out of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I will.
